about_the_game:
Build your Empire and Conquer the World

This turn-based, grand strategy game combines elements from many popular games in the genre into a new, unique assortment of game mechanics. Its single-resource economy makes the game easy to learn for new players, including ones new to the strategy games genre overall, while its many different historical and fantastical scenarios provide ample room for you to play with, and make world history. Play over a hundred turns of Konkwest for free in this demo version of the game.

Simultaneous Turns around the World

  • Get rid of your flat map game, and accept the curve in Konkwest's globe view
  • Reject sequentialism, embrace simultaneous planning, don’t wait endlessly for your turn



  • 2024 - Play (almost) any state in our modern world, even unrecognized ones
  • 2000 - That's over 20 years ago already, isn't that crazy?
  • 1900 - The buildup to WW1 belongs in any historical strategy map game
  • 1700 - Big Poland, big Sweden, big Ottoman Empire, what’s not to love
  • 1300 - Experience the Holy Roman Empire at its height in a Medieval World
  • 0 (1BC) - Challenge the great ancient empires of Rome and China, or lead them to world domination
  • Balanced - A custom scenario where the world is divided up between equally sized countries
  • Kaiserzeit 1926 - A unique alternate history created for an unknown board game



  • Create your own country in any place, and give it a unique identity
  • Change its name, its color, and its policies to your liking
  • Add other countries to your world, and see them expand or fail

Demo

In this demo you can play Konkwest for a limited number of turns. In addition to the features included in this demo, the full game offers:
  • Multiplayer, where you can play with your friends or random others from all over the world.
  • Spectate mode, where you can watch the world descend into chaos, and see an alternate history unfold.
  • Unlimited turns.

content_descriptors.notes: Konkwest includes abstract displays of violence through iconography and firework effects. Due to the game's setting it inherently involves political and historical topics.
